episodes.title: Devaluation, Transference, Narcissism with Diana Diamond
episodes.description:
In this episode, Dr. David Puder is joined by world-renowned psychologist Diana Diamond, PhD to explore devaluation, narcissism, attachment, and transference in psychotherapy. Together they examine why patients with narcissistic personality traits or narcissistic personality disorder (NPD) often devalue their therapists, how dismissing and disorganized attachment styles shape treatment, and why these cycles can be so painful for clinicians.

Dr. Diamond shares clinical insights from Transference-Focused Psychotherapy (TFP), including how to recognize subtle and overt devaluation, how to hold boundaries, how to think psychodynamically about these behaviors, and how to respond without reenacting the patient’s internal object relations. The discussion also highlights the role of trauma, reflective functioning, countertransference, and the deeper tragedy of pathological narcissism.

Link to Blog: https://www.psychiatrypodcast.com/psychiatry-psychotherapy-podcast/episode-250-devaluation-transference-narcissism-with-diana-diamond

episodes.title: Transference Focused Psychotherapy & Personality Disorders with Dr. Otto Kernberg
episodes.description:
00:47 Fleeing Nazi Austria
05:49 Early Influences
22:55 Borderline Level of Functioning and Primitive Defenses
30:24 Sexual Life in Borderline and Narcissistic Personality
45:08 Transference-Focused Psychotherapy and Reflective Function
1:03:52 Histrionic Personality
1:09:35 Paranoid Personality
1:11:19 Schizoid Personality
1:18:37 Why Therapists Want to Help

In this insightful interview, Dr. Otto Kernberg, renowned psychiatrist and pioneer of Transference-Focused Psychotherapy (TFP), shares profound insights into personality disorders, including Borderline Personality Disorder (BPD), narcissistic, schizoid, paranoid, and histrionic personalities.

Dr. Kernberg explores core psychoanalytic concepts such as identity diffusion, primitive defense mechanisms (splitting, projective identification), and the dynamics of sexuality and aggression within personality disorders. Learn how Transference-Focused Psychotherapy uniquely enhances reflective functioning and emotional integration, transforming patient outcomes.

Essential viewing for therapists, psychology students, and anyone interested in deepening their understanding of personality structure, psychoanalytic theory, and effective psychotherapy approaches.

episodes.title: Narcissism with Jonathan Shedler, PhD
episodes.description: In this episode of the podcast, we are joined by Dr. Jonathan Shedler to discuss narcissistic personality disorder. Dr. Shedler is a psychologist, consultant, clinical educator, researcher, and author with over 100 scholarly publications. His article, “The Efficacy of Psychodynamic Psychotherapy,” has garnered worldwide recognition for establishing evidence-based support of psychodynamic psychotherapy. Link to Blog:   https://www.psychiatrypodcast.com/psychiatry-psychotherapy-podcast/185-narcissism-with-jonathan-shedler
